verses.verse: Wisdom <WH2454> hath builded <WH1129> <WH8804> her house <WH1004>, she hath hewn out <WH2672> <WH8804> her seven <WH7651> pillars <WH5982>:
She hath killed <WH2873> <WH8804> her beasts <WH2874>; she hath mingled <WH4537> <WH8804> her wine <WH3196>; she hath also furnished <WH6186> <WH8804> her table <WH7979>.
She hath sent forth <WH7971> <WH8804> her maidens <WH5291>: she crieth <WH7121> <WH8799> upon <WH1610> the highest places <WH4791> of the city <WH7176>,
Whoso is simple <WH6612>, let him turn in <WH5493> <WH8799> hither: as for him that wanteth <WH2638> understanding <WH3820>, she saith <WH559> <WH8804> to him,
Come <WH3212> <WH8798>, eat <WH3898> <WH8798> of my bread <WH3899>, and drink <WH8354> <WH8798> of the wine <WH3196> which I have mingled <WH4537> <WH8804>.
Forsake <WH5800> <WH8798> the foolish <WH6612>, and live <WH2421> <WH8798>; and go <WH833> <WH8798> in the way <WH1870> of understanding <WH998>.

He that reproveth <WH3256> <WH8802> a scorner <WH3887> <WH8801> getteth <WH3947> <WH8802> to himself shame <WH7036>: and he that rebuketh <WH3198> <WH8688> a wicked <WH7563> man getteth himself a blot <WH3971>.
Reprove <WH3198> <WH8686> not a scorner <WH3887> <WH8801>, lest he hate <WH8130> <WH8799> thee: rebuke <WH3198> <WH8685> a wise man <WH2450>, and he will love <WH157> <WH8799> thee.

Give <WH5414> <WH8798> instruction to a wise <WH2450> man, and he will be yet wiser <WH2449> <WH8799>: teach <WH3045> <WH8685> a just <WH6662> man, and he will increase <WH3254> <WH8686> in learning <WH3948>.
The fear <WH3374> of the YY <WH3068> is the beginning <WH8462> of wisdom <WH2451>: and the knowledge <WH1847> of the holy <WH6918> is understanding <WH998>.
For by me thy days <WH3117> shall be multiplied <WH7235> <WH8799>, and the years <WH8141> of thy life <WH2416> shall be increased <WH3254> <WH8686>.
If thou be wise <WH2449> <WH8804>, thou shalt be wise <WH2449> <WH8804> for thyself: but if thou scornest <WH3887> <WH8804>, thou alone shalt bear <WH5375> <WH8799> it.
A foolish <WH3687> woman <WH802> is clamorous <WH1993> <WH8802>: she is simple <WH6615>, and <WH1077> knoweth <WH3045> <WH8804> nothing <WH4100>.
For she sitteth <WH3427> <WH8804> at the door <WH6607> of her house <WH1004>, on a seat <WH3678> in the high places <WH4791> of the city <WH7176>,
To call <WH7121> <WH8800> passengers <WH5674> <WH8802> <WH1870> who go right <WH3474> <WH8764> on their ways <WH734>:
Whoso is simple <WH6612>, let him turn in <WH5493> <WH8799> hither: and as for him that wanteth <WH2638> understanding <WH3820>, she saith <WH559> <WH8804> to him,
Stolen <WH1589> <WH8803> waters <WH4325> are sweet <WH4985> <WH8799>, and bread <WH3899> eaten in secret <WH5643> is pleasant <WH5276> <WH8799>.
But he knoweth <WH3045> <WH8804> not that the dead <WH7496> are there; and that her guests <WH7121> <WH8803> are in the depths <WH6012> of SH'ol <WH7585>.
